title: Week 7 schedule brings key games
text:
Week 7 schedule brings key games Bobby Ardoin 5:35 p.m. CDT October 11, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
It’s too early for declaring any certainties in district races. 
After all, three leagues in the Daily World coverage areas just played their first intra-district contests on Friday night. 
Still the preseason favorites in 4-4A, 5-3A and 5-1A performed as expected to open district. 
District 5-2A with eight teams, is already moving into their fourth week. 
As Week 7 moves into focus, several key games are scheduled for this Friday night. 
In 4-4A, St. Thomas More (5-1, 1-0) and Carencro (4-2, 1-0), play Friday night in the league’s key game. 
Teurlings Catholic, expected at the start of the season to compete for the league title, goes to Beau Chene. 
Beau Chene and Opelousas, the two St. Landry Parish teams in 4-4A, lost their league openers this week by a combined 139-8. 
Opelousas, winless under first-year head coach Dwight Collns, has another tough game at Northside. 
Eunice (5-1, 1-0) and Northwest (5-1, 1-0) meet in the key District 5-3A contest on Friday night. 
The Bobcats feature a high-scoring offense that will confront a Northwest defense which is improved over last season. 
Church Point (5-1, 1-0) which was picked in the preseason to compete for the title along with Eunice plays at Pine Prairie (3-3, 0-1) on Thursday night. 
The Bears are featuring an offense that has thrown an average of 10 passes per game behind quarterback Troy Matte. 
Pine Prairie has two of the league’s most exciting backs in Dylan Doucet and Douglas Fontenot. 
The focus on the key 5-1A game this week is in Basile where Westminster Christian Academy visits also for a Thursday night contest. 
Basile (5-1, 1-0) was chosen to be the league champion at the start of the season. 
WCA, however, has an enthusiastic young team that has played well throughout the first half of 2015. 
The Crusaders (4-2, 0-1) lost in the final seconds Friday night at New Roads on what could be documented as one of Louisiana high school football’s most bizarre plays. 
Catholic High Pointe Coupee collected a blocked field goal attempt by WCA’s Noah Launey and returned it for the game-winning touchdown. 
WCA’s loss allowed Catholic Pointe Coupee (3-3, 1-0) to continue as an emerging challenger for the 5-1A title. 
The challenge Thursday for CHPC is St. Edmund, which brings the top passing combination to New Roads. 
St. Edmund quarterback Drake Brunet and running back-receiver Gibson Lafleur have combined for nearly 800 passing yards. 
Brunet has thrown for over 1,200 yards. 
Thursday’s Games 
• Church Point (5-1, 1-0) at Pine Prairie (3-3, 0-1) 
• Westminster (4-2, 0-1) at Basile (5-1, 1-0) 
• St. Edmund (2-4, 1-0) at Catholic-PC (3-3, 1-0) 
Friday’s Games 
• Opelousas (0-5, 0-1) at Northside (1-5, 0-1) 
• Teurlings (4-2, 1-0) at Beau Chene (4-2, 0-1) 
• Northwest (5-1, 1-0) at Eunice (5-1, 1-0) 
• Ville Platte (3-3, 0-1) at Port Barre (4-2, 0-1) 
• Loreauville (5-1, 2-1) at Sacred Heart (2-4, 1-2) 
• Delcambre (1-5, 1-2) at Opelousas Catholic (4-2, 2-1) 
• False River (2-4, 0-1) at North Central (0-6, 0-1) Read or Share this story: http://www.dailyworld.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/11/week-schedule-brings-key-games/73790962/ TOP VIDEOS
